caption.p: Distribution of Dipterocarpus turbinatus and Shorea robusta forests (Appanah & Turnbull, 1998; Champion & Seth, 1968; Gautam & Devoe, 2006; Huda et al., 2006) was matched with the ecoregions in South and Southeast Asia (Peel et al., 2007; Table S1 for details). The red polygon depicts the ecoregions for D. turbinatus dominant in the evergreen, semievergreen, and deciduous forests of Bangladesh, India, Myanmar, Thailand, Cambodia, and Vietnam, whereas the blue polygon depicts the ecoregions for S. robusta dominant in tropical moist and dry deciduous forests of India, Bangladesh, Nepal, and Bhutan
